llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach: payment_format_ach = 1 contributed strongly to an increased score (SHAP +3.05803), so the ACH payment method was the primary driver of the flag.
- dayofweek: dayofweek = 6 (Sunday) increased the score (SHAP +0.719058), indicating the transaction timing (Sunday) pushed the alert higher.
- amount_received and amount_paid: amount_received = 17,113.6 (SHAP +0.604153) and amount_paid = 17,113.6 (SHAP +0.494747) both increased the score, so the magnitude of the payment in the reported currency contributed to the flag.
- from_bank: from_bank = 222 decreased the score (SHAP −0.671646), so the sender bank identifier partially offset the other increasing factors.

Conclusion:
The model flagged this transaction mainly because it was an ACH payment (payment_format_ach=1) of relatively large size (amount_received and amount_paid ≈ 17,113.6) executed on dayofweek=6 (Sunday), with those factors producing the largest positive SHAP contributions. This increase was partially mitigated by the negative contribution from from_bank=222. If further review is needed, focus checks on the ACH characteristics and the Sunday execution, since those features most directly drove the alert.
